item.title: Main File & Main Function Explained
item.description:
This metaphor will help you understand programming concepts more easily and remember them better.

What you‚Äôll learn in this video:

  1. How to compare a project folder with house land
  2. Why main.c works like the main gate of a program
  3. How the main function is like the first room you enter
  4. Key features of C files (.c extension)
  5. Importance of #include [stdio.h], int main(), and return 0;

item.title: DataType Selection in C | ‡¶°‡ßá‡¶ü‡¶æ ‡¶ü‡¶æ‡¶á‡¶™‡ßá‡¶∞ ‡¶Æ‡ßÇ‡¶≤ ‡¶ß‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶£‡¶æ
item.description:
Everything in a computer‚Äôs memory is stored as 0s and 1s, but why do we need to choose a data type?

C Data Types

In the C language, the basic data types are:

  • char ‚Üí a single character or a small number
  • int ‚Üí a whole number (integer)
  • float ‚Üí a decimal number with small precision
  • double ‚Üí a decimal number with higher precision

What you‚Äôll learn in this video:

  • What a data type is and why it‚Äôs important
  • Basic C data types: char, int, float, double
  • How to choose the right data type for different values
  • Differences between char, string, and decimal numbers
  • Simple practical examples explained clearly
